main event: Observers noted a bright white light in the northeast sky over Southampton, Long Island, New York, on October 30, 1966, with the object being stationary and flashing various colors.
interesting points: The object flashed colors including red, green, and white during the sighting.,Witnesses reported observing the light for approximately 30 minutes.,The object appeared to drift slowly to the south after remaining stationary.,No physical evidence or photographs were taken of the event.,The conclusion drawn by investigators was that the sighting was likely an astronomical phenomenon, possibly the star Rigel.
sighted object: a bright white light in the sky
witness description: A 17-year-old student who observed the light and reported the sighting.
